senses.sense_definition: A small unit of weight used historically in the apothecary system (equal to one eighth of an ounce) or the avoirdupois system (equal to one sixteenth of an ounce).

examples.text: The pharmacist carefully weighed out a <w>drachm</w> of the medicinal powder.
In older recipe books, ingredients are often listed in ounces and <w>drachms</w>.

traits.comment: mostly replaced by metric or the spelling 'dram'

senses.sense_definition: An alternative form of the word <w>drachma</w>, referring to an ancient Greek silver coin or unit of weight.

examples.text: The museum collection includes a rare silver <w>drachm</w> from Athens.
He paid a single <w>drachm</w> to the merchant for the small clay pot.
